summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing travel approval and logistics for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, related to the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail flight and hotel bookings, per diem issues, and reference several prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Maureen Comey
persons.context: Sent the initial travel approval request for the Epstein investigation trip to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale in March 2019. Her signature block is at the end of the document.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm

keyFacts: The document is a series of email correspondences from January 2020 regarding travel logistics for a U.S. Attorney's Office team to conduct an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, as part of the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618).
The emails reference multiple prior domestic trips for the same investigation in 2019, including to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, for victim interviews and meetings.
The travel requests consistently mention the need for conference rooms at hotels to conduct interviews.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'

The correspondence shows logistical challenges, such as hotels being over per diem and incorrect location data in the booking system (E2), with the FBI Legat potentially assisting through the Embassy.
